message_1: What is the Mach number of a supersonic flow if the local speed of sound is 340 m/s and the fluid velocity is 680 m/s?
message_2:
The Mach number is defined as the ratio of the fluid velocity to the local speed of sound. In this case, the fluid velocity is 680 m/s and the local speed of sound is 340 m/s. To find the Mach number, simply divide the fluid velocity by the local speed of sound:

Mach number = (fluid velocity) / (local speed of sound)
Mach number = 680 m/s / 340 m/s
Mach number = 2

So, the Mach number of the supersonic flow is 2.
